file_content.text: Ah. Our hero returns.
Our heroes return. Very good.
Had you merely stopped the Shroud's craven attack, I would have been content. But to strike a name from my most-wanted list.... All the better.
Can't believe I followed that maniac. Thanks to you, I don't gotta worry about him ever again. The Shroud can't touch me.
Deposit the credits to my account, Mortis. I'm out.
If we're done here...
The survival of the Empire is all that mattered here, as I would imagine Darth Mortis has already made clear to you.
I didn't kill him for you, Bo.
What will you do now that you're no longer employed?
What's next for you?
Working for a spy, one thing you can't do is see your family. So maybe that--if Darth Mortis says I'm free to go.
The Shroud wasn't quite as formidable as I was led to believe. I'm surprised you never caught him, Mortis.
He wasn't so tough.
I'm afraid Darth Mortis cannot hear you. I control the holo now.
I did so enjoy your fevered battle against my double. He did have the look down, but sadly lacked my fighting prowess.
I'll--I'll help them find you, Shroud. Help them find you and kill you!
Evie. Oh, Evie. It saddens me to do this, but you've left me no choice. With but a word, I bid you farewell....
"Asunder."
Agh! No...! No!
A neural scrambler, activated upon my utterance of the trigger word. She's gone now, our Evie. Well--her memories, at any rate.
I'm not impressed.
Say any word you like, Shroud. You're an insignificant coward for not facing me.
It's not as though I wouldn't enjoy that, Wrath. It's merely inconvenient for me.
It would seem you aren't a master strategist after all; rather a master of theatrics. Pathetic.
I do try, but we can't all put on airs from the storied halls of the Dark Council, can we?
Cheap tricks and doubles? Nothing I haven't seen before, Shroud.
I would expect such confidence from a veteran of the Blacklist--but believe me, hunter, you've seen so very little.
If you were truly a master spy, you wouldn't have tipped your hand so soon.
Unless I was so sure of my state of security that I had nothing to fear from anyone--including you, Commander.
I'll have to remember that one for the next time I'm betrayed.
Nice move.
You would have to duplicate my original design first. I don't see it.
You'll run out of doubles eventually, Shroud, and when that day comes....
I'll kill you, Shroud.
Well. This has been a truly fascinating effort. I may not have succeeded in my goal, but if not for my failure, we would never have met.
I do look forward to sparring again--so to speak. I'll see you around.
The Shroud? Alive? And what's wrong with her?
What am I doing here? Who are you? And... and who....
Who am I?
You're a veteran mercenary who will use those skills to serve the Empire for the remainder of her life.
You're the Empire's property.
I--I am? If you say I am, then... okay. I must be.
I'm satisfied with that arrangement--so long as her talents have remained intact, of course. She's worthless to us otherwise.
I'm needed elsewhere. Good work saving Kaas City from that madman. You may keep the macrobinoculars. Consider them a bonus.
Your intervention was instrumental in ending the Shroud's plot. The least the Empire can do in return is help you recover your mind.
The Empire will help you.
I did what?
A fair enough plan. After all, the information lost in her head is surely of value to us, considering the Shroud is still at large.
The Empire is safe for now. You've done well. You may keep the macrobinoculars--with my compliments.
That's it. You did it. Kaas City's safe. Mortis says he wants to debrief you, so guess you better come on back.
I don't believe it. You killed the Shroud!
Now quick--shut down the works before that ship comes crashing into Kaas City! Hurry!
Okay--structural weaknesses, a dreadnaught, a ship remote and... schematics for a hyperspace beacon? And.... No. Aw, no.
The Shroud's planted a hyperspace beacon in Kaas City! Now he can pull the dreadnaught out of hyperspace within the planet's atmosphere! He'll crash it into the city!
I'll tell Mortis we gotta hunt for this beacon on Kaas, but it could be anywhere! Only way to shut all this down is to find the Shroud!
Luckily, his ego gave him no choice but to keep taunting you. I used those calls to triangulate his location. Go. Go!
Darth Mortis ain't gonna sound any alarms on Kaas, you know. No preemptive evacuations--except for himself, of course.
Got your new coordinates. You know the drill--smash, bash and grab.
Wow. Any regrets I might've had about abandoning the Shroud are gone. Wouldn't wanna be in your way....
Huh. Operating instructions for a ship remote. Must be for that dreadnaught. Can't remote pilot that thing into Kaas without planetary defenses kicking in, so....
Yeah, I'm stumped. But here--got a treasure trove of relay data we can use. We're close. I'm feeling it.
There we go. Pinged another lieutenant. Can't make sense of the Shroud's plan of attack yet--let's keep plowing on.
Heh. Nice. Never saw eye to eye with that one, anyway. Okay, got your data packet... Invoices, more invoices....
The Shroud recently bought himself... a dreadnaught? Right, like he's got a crew to man a ship that big.
Datastamp confirms it's connected to the report on Kaas, though. Also gives us some more of the network to play with. New coordinates for you. We're getting there.
You know, this is actually kinda fun. I could get used to tearing down the Shroud's network....
Okay, got enough here to put you into the next lieutenant's neighborhood, but you still gotta triangulate the doorstep yourself. Coordinates updated.
There. We got enough to pin down the lieutenant's location. Now go do your worst.
Hey--that's one of the Shroud's spy droids. Won't help us triangulate anything, but keep an eye out for more of them suckers.
Yep, that's it--that's exactly what you're looking for. Keep at it.
Hey, I just thought of something we might wanna look into. Coordinates plugged in.
The Shroud's out there. Go get him!
I see you've finally arrived. Let me introduce you: this is Evie Bo.
I can speak for myself, okay? I'm top lieutenant to the galaxy's most brilliant freelance superspy, the Shroud. I mean, I was.
The who?
No mere spy can stand against the unchecked power of the Force--certainly not some supposed legend I've never heard of.
I doubt this "brilliant" character is a match for me; I'd have heard of him otherwise.
If you say so, my lord. But there's a reason you haven't heard of him before now: he's that good.
If this guy's wanted so badly, how come I've never heard of him?
You're saying there's a prominent spy that I haven't heard of? Am I hearing you correctly?
The Shroud's taken to laying so low he's just about been forgotten. Won't be true much longer, though.
So you don't work for him anymore? What happened?
"Was?"
What happened is the whole reason I'm here.
Mind your manners.
I wouldn't go around spouting off at Darths. Me, I can get away with it--but you?
Watch how you address your betters.
Let her speak as she will. I find her base gruffness... quaint.
The Shroud's been semi-retired a while, but he got fidgety. Took a gig from the Hutt Cartel to spy on you guys. Republic, too.
Seems in all his spying, the Shroud's found something. A challenge. He's planning some kinda rogue attack--on Dromund Kaas.
Tell me everything you know about this attack.
He has to be stopped.
That's the problem. I tried to uncover what I could...
Is this a political statement? Some sort of revenge?
Why would he attack?
Morality, petty emotional stuff--that don't enter into it. Can he do it and can he get away with it? That's what matters to him.
You say the Hutt Cartel's been spying. What are they after?
What were the Hutts up to?
Some business on Makeb? The Hutts wanted to make sure they had all their angles covered first. Didn't care, didn't ask.
Repeat what you told me, Bo. Explain why you've turned traitor.
The Shroud, he always consults with me. This time, though--nothing. So I pried. Learned about Kaas.
An attack on the Empire? That's suicide. Told him as much. As thanks for speaking my mind, he tried to have me killed, so here I am.
You were right to come here. Your boss has signed his own death sentence.
That is indeed suicide.
Good. That's what I needed to hear.
Your employer clearly doesn't know what an asset he has.
[Flirt] He's a fool.
Pouring it on a little thick, pal. Let's stick to the impending doom on the Empire's capital world.
Lady, I'm flattered, but it ain't me you should be thinking about right now.
Yes, please--let us continue with the matter at hand.
How do we know you aren't just some disgruntled employee making things up? Or a double agent?
I don't buy it.
You're smart to be on your guard. I would be, too--but I ain't lying.
I can assure you our interrogators have thoroughly "vetted" our informant. She's being quite truthful.
Like I said, he told me nothing--but I got a line on where another lieutenant's holed up. And I got special macrobinoculars to help you find him.
They're the Shroud's design--beyond top of the line. Contracted the parts from all over, assembled them himself.

These macrobinoculars are no mere magnifiers; they're fitted with a wide range of analytical and communications applications, even a Miraluka interface. They will be utterly indispensable in your search.
I would prefer to find this "Shroud" and choke the details out of him, but I suppose this method will have to do.
I'll be your... investigator.
You'll find plenty resistance, if that's your thing. Might even face the Shroud himself, and he's no pushover.
No doubt this "Shroud" has already set his plans in motion. I suggest we employ haste.
Time is short. Let us begin.
The meter's on and the chrono's ticking. Tell me where I'm headed.
Let's get moving.
I'm all for saving the Empire from harm, but I'll be disappointed if I don't meet this so-called "superspy."
Hope I can meet this "Shroud."
If this goes as expected, he'll wanna meet you, too. But I wouldn't wish that meeting on anyone.
Bo, you said I'm looking for a lieutenant.... What information will he have?
What will I find?
The Shroud keeps his data fragmented across his entire surveillance network. That lieutenant will have a piece of the Shroud's plan.
I don't know.... This all sounds like paranoid nonsense.
I remain unconvinced.
An attack on Dromund Kaas could easily be catastrophic for us. We have no choice but to be ever vigilant.
The lieutenant's basic coordinates are already plugged into the binocs. You'll use them to find key relay points that will help us triangulate an exact position.
While you're out there, I'll be scrounging together more intel. I'll keep up on your progress through the binocs and keep you informed of whatever I find, too.
May your actions be swift and your results beyond reproach; the fate of the Empire requires it. Mortis out.
Yeah? What're you looking at?
Guess I owe you my thanks? Can't remember why, though....
